attributes.action: not tax car owners who drive to work £350.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The government is bringing in a tax to business of £250 rising to £350 for each car place over 10 cars. This tax can be passed on to employees. It claims it is to aid congestion, but is a blatent tax on those who drive to work. It claims will be invested in public transport. However,it is going to councils many of whom are in debt.

rejection.details:
There are already similar petitions on the Number 10 website, some relating to specific regions and others others more general: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/ParkingCarTax/

http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/KeepEngland-FREE/

You may wish to add your name to these petitions instead.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
